lead_paragraph: New research published in Annals of Internal Medicine suggested that only about half of women with dense tissue need extra tests.

headline.print_headline: Study Suggests Dense Breast Tissue Isn’t Always a Cancer Risk Requiring Extra Tests
headline.main: Study Suggests Dense Breast Tissue Isn’t Always a High Cancer Risk

snippet: New research published in Annals of Internal Medicine suggested that only about half of women with dense tissue need extra tests.
abstract: Study published in Annals of Internal Medicine finds that only about half of women with dense breast tissue are at very high risk of cancer and need extra tests beyond simple mammography; suggests women with dense breast tissue work with their physicians to consider other risk factors before deciding on additional tests.
